details.title: Voting on 119 seat Telangana legislative assembly begins
details.content:
Voting has begins in Telagnana. Voters are seen queuing at the polling booths early morning in Hyderabad.

 

Telangana: People queue outside a polling station in Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad to cast their votes. Voting is being held in 119 constituencies of the state today. #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/pkAAk6PZ88

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

details.title: Former Siddipet MLA T Harish Rao votes in his constituency.
details.content:
Telangana: State Irrigation Minister T Harish Rao casts his vote in polling booth no. 102 in Siddipet constituency. #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/2q2tqbgoXl

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

details.title: Technical problems surface in Hyderabad.
details.content:
Hyderabad: Voting is yet to begin at the polling station at GHMC Indoor Stadium, Amberpet due to a technical problem. Voting in the state began at 7 am today, #TelanganaElections2018

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

details.title: Watch| Can TRS hold their bastion?
TNIE podcasts: Agrarian distress in Telangana
details.content: Agrarian distress was one of the major reasons for the demand of separate statehood. So after four years of TRS how much has the situation changed?

details.title: Tollywood votes for Telagnana.
details.content:
Telangana: Actor Allu Arjun stands in a queue to cast his vote at booth no. 152 in Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad. #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/5kuui5v5Wy

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

Telangana: Actor Akkineni Nagarjuna and his wife & actor Amala Akkineni stand in a queue to cast their votes at booth no. 151 in Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad. #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/IZpOhBmyTU

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

details.title: 'Honest' BJP MLA G Kishen Reddy votes.
details.content:
Telangana: BJP's G Kishan Reddy casts his vote at polling booth no.7 in Kachiguda, Hyderabad. #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/HRuneW8maY

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

READ| We don't like BJP but will vote for Kishen Reddy, say Amberpet residents

details.title: Wheelchair arranged for PWD voter in Khairatabad.
details.content:
A PWD voter shows his inked finger at the St Nizam's High School, Banjara Hills in Khairatabad constituency. He was guided into and outside the polling station by a volunteer with a wheelchair. @zcwz_ghmc #TelanganaElections2018 #AccessibleElections #Khairatabad #Hyderabad pic.twitter.com/z3MPTN6vOz

— Donita Jose (@DonitaJose) December 7, 2018

details.title: EVMs malfunction in Karwan.
details.content:
In picture: one of the voting machines that is still not working at Karwan. Apart from that ECI officials who are supposed to guide voters are not present. Police (in second picture) are guiding voters #TelanganaElections2018 #Telangana pic.twitter.com/KY5MS4Iymw

— Aihik Sur (@AihikSur) December 7, 2018

In picture: one of the voting machines that is still not working at Karwan. Apart from that ECI officials who are supposed to guide voters are not present. Police (in second picture) are guiding voters #TelanganaElections2018 #Telangana pic.twitter.com/KY5MS4Iymw

— Aihik Sur (@AihikSur) December 7, 2018

details.title: Senior police officers cast vote
details.content:
#TelanganaElections2018 : Senior #IPSofficers @AddlCPCrimesHyd, @CPHydCity, @cyberabadpolice exercise their votes at different polling stations in #Hyderabad, @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/WeFoPCaXAA

— Mouly Mareedu (@Mouli_TNIE) December 7, 2018

details.title: Deputy CM Kadiyan Srihari  cast his vote in Warangal.
details.content:
Telangana: Deputy Chief Minister Kadiyan Srihari cast his vote in Warangal. #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/MLrZdGI4Dc

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018
8.97 per cent voter turnout till 9 am.

#TelanganaElections2018 : Till 9.30 am, at least 10.46 per cent polling is reported in #Telangana, @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/BPnF8WlK5C

— Mouly Mareedu (@Mouli_TNIE) December 7, 2018
AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi casts his vote at polling booth no. 317 at Mailardevpally, Shastripura.

details.title: TRS MP from Nizamabad K Kavitha stands in queue to cast vote.
details.content:
TRS MP K Kavitha stands in a queue to cast her vote at polling booth no. 177 in Pothangal, Nizamabad. #TelanganaElection2018 pic.twitter.com/3sQskAJzUs

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

details.title: Junior NTR votes in Khairatabad.
details.content:
Grandson of NTR, @tarak9999 has voted at Khairatabad Constituency. #TelanganaElections2018 #JuniorNTR pic.twitter.com/JgPwox0P2H

— Donita Jose (@DonitaJose) December 7, 2018

details.title: Several voters complain of missing names in Rasoolpura.
details.content:
Scores of people in #Rasoolpura who voted in 2014 #elections, complained their names are missing in voters list #Secunderabad #Hyderabad #TelanganaElections2018

— ShivaShankerK_TNIE (@Shanker_TNIE) December 7, 2018

details.title: Jwala Gutta's name missing from voter list.
details.content:
How’s the election fair...when names r mysteriously disappearing from the list!! 😡🤬

— Gutta Jwala (@Guttajwala) December 7, 2018

details.title: After Karwan,  EVMs, VVPAT machines malfunction occurs in Amberpet.
details.content:
.#polling station at Lal Bahadur school in Nimboliadda, Amberpet Constituency, has a lot of people standing due to faulty EVM and VVPAT machines.
Polling started an hour late.@NewIndianXpress #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/EOnFVD9YcZ

— Ajay Moses (@ajaymoses_tnie) December 7, 2018

. A #GHMC employee rests her broom for a quick break at a polling station in Amberpet. Polling stations were sanitised with chlorine powder after brooming was done.@NewIndianXpress #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/C71GrdHNdK

— Ajay Moses (@ajaymoses_tnie) December 7, 2018

details.title: Senior citizens make extra effort at Charminar constituency.
details.content:
In this polling booth in Charminar constituency, it is a quite a task for senior citizens to scale the steep stairs. #TelanganaElections2018 #TelanganaElections pic.twitter.com/5xw6864NtN

— Aihik Sur (@AihikSur) December 7, 2018

details.title: Polling stations at Khairatabad and Jubliee Hills constituency experience link failure.
details.content:
Many polling stations in Khairatabad and Jubliee Hills started late due to fault in establishing a link between the EVM and VVPAT. 45 minute delays reported in these constituencies#TelanganaElections2018

— Donita Jose (@DonitaJose) December 7, 2018

"I did not even go to my village so that we can vote. Now we don't find our name in voters list" - a visibly annoyed Vishveshwar Rao voted in 2014 elections #MarketBazaar #Secunderabad #Hyderabad #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/XFaSDs7sHY

— ShivaShankerK_TNIE (@Shanker_TNIE) December 7, 2018

details.title: Just 10 per cent voting at Charminar constituency.
details.content:
With 10 per cent reported polling in Charminar constituency, booths wore a deserted look at 11.25 pm #TelanganaElections2018 #TelanganaElections pic.twitter.com/nq60T6s3jr

— Aihik Sur (@AihikSur) December 7, 2018

details.title: KT Rama Rao queue in to cast vote at Banjara Hills.
details.content:
Minister @KTRTRS in queue to vote at a school in Banjara Hills. He voted from Khairatabad constituency. #TelanganaElections2018 @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/HpqbQbVLQx

— Donita Jose (@DonitaJose) December 7, 2018

details.title: Brothers confused over missing names in voter list, choose not to vote this elections.
details.content:
At Chaderghat in #Hyderabad Baldawa brothers are confused whether to vote or no as their names in the rolls go missing. While one brother cast his vote, the two other's didn't . They don't want to miss on voting.@NewIndianXpress #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/4OiI26oWWP

— Ajay Moses (@ajaymoses_tnie) December 7, 2018

details.title: Over 23 per cent voting in Telangana till 11:00 am.
details.content:
At 11am, voters turnout recorded at 16.16% in Hyderabad district and 23.4 % across Telangana. @NewIndianXpress

— Rahul V Pisharody (@Rahul_TNIE) December 7, 2018

Some voters who came to exercise their right at polling station in Mahboob College were disappointed not to find their name in list. They called officials to inform they are returning without casting vote #Secunderabad #Hyderabad #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/GmI08HeJWT

— ShivaShankerK_TNIE (@Shanker_TNIE) December 7, 2018

Tollywood has come out to vote for #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/bYmDgaet96

— Donita Jose (@DonitaJose) December 7, 2018

details.title: Congress candidate attacked on the eve of Telangana polls, BJP hand suspected.
details.content:
Congress candidate Vamshichand Reddy of Kalwakurthy assembly segment is in hospital after some persons suspected to be BJP workers hurled stones at his car near jangireddypally polling station in Amangal in Kalwakurthy assembly constituency Friday morning

#vehicle belonging to @INCTelangana #Chevella candidate allegedly damaged and #supporters #attacked by opponents #Nawabpet #Rangareddy #TelanganaElections2018 @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/zD6ZOaVGtR

— Pinto Deepak_TNIE (@PintoDeepak1) December 7, 2018

details.title: EVMs still not functional at several polling booths in Karwan.
details.content:
Meanwhile, its past 12 pm and EVMs at some places in Karwan are still faulty. Lubna Sarwath, a contestant from the constituency said, "Ps 66: after 296 votes third time the vvpat has failed and voting has stopped. Sector officer not responding..." #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/XyFIazXrCL

— Aihik Sur (@AihikSur) December 7, 2018

Sania Mirza cast her vote at Film Nagar Cultural Center in Hyderabad. #TelanganaElections pic.twitter.com/GlD1jNSPRo

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

details.title: BJP MP Bandaru Dattatreya cast his vote in Musheerabad.
details.content:
Telangana: BJP MP Bandaru Dattatreya casts his vote at booth no.229 in Ramnagar of Musheerabad constituency in Hyderabad. #TelanganaElections pic.twitter.com/D8gLFfJBUj

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

No ramp at the polling station in IEA school, Shaikpet in Jubliee hills constituency. Four disabled voters were assigned to this station and the volunteers lifted them on wheelchairs to assist.. #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/tNWei6q9yu

— Donita Jose (@DonitaJose) December 7, 2018

READ | Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation makes voting easier for disabled

details.title: An explainer of the Telangana elections
Over 43 percent of voting till 1 pm
details.content:
Official correction by #Telangana CEO, the poll percentage up to 1 pm in #Telangana Assembly is 43.24. At 1 pm in Hyderabad the poll percentage is 28.28 @NewIndianXpress

— V.V. Balakrishna-TNIE (@balaexpressTNIE) December 7, 2018

details.title: Hyderabadis share their voting experience
With zero incidents, peaceful elections till now.
details.content:
Seventy-year-old Balladeer and former Naxalite Gadar used his voting right for the first time today in #Hyderabad. He backed the Congress-TDP led Grand Alliance in #Telangana Assembly polls @NewIndianXpress

— V.V. Balakrishna-TNIE (@balaexpressTNIE) December 7, 2018

"No incidents reported, so far peaceful," confirmed police. Two hours to go for the #TelanaganaElections2018 to conclude. However most "incidences" usually happen in the last two hours.

— Aihik Sur (@AihikSur) December 7, 2018

details.title: Voters fail to exercise right as more names missing from voters list
details.content:
#techie 4m #Chennai Praveen Kumar came home to cast #VOTE but his name missing in #TelanganaElections2018 list @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/pz4HE3P0Aj

— Pinto Deepak_TNIE (@PintoDeepak1) December 7, 2018

details.title: Major food outlets, markets remain closed while movie theatres remain open on election day
details.content:
The hotel famous for Hyderabadi #biryani Bawarchi, and Astoria Hotels are shutters down. Other prominent eating outlets too are closed on day of elections #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/eRkKUnmxUF

— ShivaShankerK_TNIE (@Shanker_TNIE) December 7, 2018

It's business as usual at theatres in RTC X roads. In fact theatres screening prominent movies are full house #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/hgR9M2xh6s

— ShivaShankerK_TNIE (@Shanker_TNIE) December 7, 2018

details.title: KCR flies down to Siddipet to cast his vote
details.content:
#Telangana CM and #TRS president heli-hopped from #Hyderabad to Chintamadaka in Siddipet Assembly segment and exercised his franchise @NewIndianXpress

— V.V. Balakrishna-TNIE (@balaexpressTNIE) December 7, 2018

details.title: Right to vote denied to Gachibowli residents
details.content:
As many as 400 families of Keshav Nagar in Gachibowli couldn't exercise their vote as they didn't get a right to vote. These were the families that were asked to move in a midnight swoop, early this year.@NewIndianXpress #TelanganaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/I1PXbgkA3Y

— Mahesh_TNIE (@maheemahesh25) December 7, 2018
56.17 per cent voter turnout till 3 pm

details.title: District wise poll percentage. Alampur highest with over 71% voting
details.content:
District wise poll percentage at 3pm ... its 56.17% for the state at 3pm pic.twitter.com/vUsYRcYLvj

— Arvind Kumar (@arvindkumar_ias) December 7, 2018

95 #year old Bandari Rebeccamma caste her #Vote #TelanganaElections2018
along with her #family at New vidyanagar #colony #Neredmet #Malkajgiri constituency @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/ozJyLsmFOy

— Pinto Deepak_TNIE (@PintoDeepak1) December 7, 2018

details.title: Now Hyderbad DGP's name goes missing; returns home dejected
details.content:
Today, I went to the Polling Station only to be told that my name is not there in the Voter list inspite of having a Voter ID card issued by ECI and a verification.
I returned home https://t.co/jwsZzNZ2ZZ Right to Vote has been denied.
Thanks to Election Commission. pic.twitter.com/iLT4TBOb5r

— T Krishna Prasad IPS (@tkp1080) December 7, 2018

A volunteer, Ramu, near a polling station in Chikadpally who was flipping electoral rolls said that his wife's name too is missing from list & wondered why don't people with names in the list step out to vote. A dismal 33% voted there #whereismyvote #TelanganaElections2018

— ShivaShankerK_TNIE (@Shanker_TNIE) December 7, 2018

details.title: KTR confident of winning by two third majority
details.content:
With polling coming to an end in #Telangana, IT and Industries Minister KT Rama Rao exuded confidence that #TRS would get two-thirds majority @NewIndianXpress

— V.V. Balakrishna-TNIE (@balaexpressTNIE) December 7, 2018

details.title: BJP workers caught red handed while distributing cash to voters.
details.content:
#two @BJP4Telangana workers caught redhanded by @psraidurgam_cyb @cyberabadpolice while distributing #money to lure #Voters #TelanganaElections2018 @NewIndianXpress

— Pinto Deepak_TNIE (@PintoDeepak1) December 7, 2018

details.title: Voting concludes in majority of the state amid several reports of missing names from voter list, EVM malfunction
details.content:
More than 100 voters alleges deletion of names , stages dharna in Kamareddy town@thenewsminute pic.twitter.com/wAAZlcJYKz

— CharanTeja (@CharanT16) December 7, 2018

details.title: 67% voter turnout so far final figures awaited.
details.content:
Umesh Sinha, Election Commission: Voting is still underway at some polling stations. Final figures are still to come. Interim voter turnout recorded till now in #TelanganaAssemblyElections2018 is 67%. Last year, voter turnout recorded was 69.5%. pic.twitter.com/g5rH6AMiG0

— ANI (@ANI) December 7, 2018

details.title: Here is what exit polls say
details.content: Times Now-CNX projected a clean sweep for the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samiti with 66 seats in the 119-seat Assembly. It gave 37 to Congress and 7 to BJP while others were given 9. READ FULL STORY HERE
